intro: Tragus koelerioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf tragus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of pink or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It is an erect perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in the wild.
